original_text: We sat down next to each other, but David wouldn't look at me. He lowered his head what he was thinking. I had high hopes for him so I wanted to let him join the cross-country. I comforted him in a soothing voice, "you have work so hard for this event. I hope your work hard is rewarding, I will support you forever." My words like a warm stream rushed his being. David raised his eyes meet my eyes with his eyes sparkling with confident. David felt inspired. I was pleased beyond description that I can light his strong determination. David was thinking for a while, "I hope I can try it." He laughed, his eyes shining with excitement. I pulled him into my arms, "I believe you can do it." I watched as David moved up to the starting line with the other runners. But David still had butterflies in his stomach and his hands were sweaty. With starting competition. So nervous was him that he was slow.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: He lowered his head what he was thinking.
detailed_errors.correction: He lowered his head, wondering what he was thinking.
detailed_errors.explanation: 原句缺少连接词，导致句子不完整。应使用现在分词作伴随状语。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: He bowed his head, lost in thought about whether he should run.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: I had high hopes for him so I wanted to let him join the cross-country.
detailed_errors.correction: I had high hopes for him, so I wanted to encourage him to join the cross-country team.
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: I had great expectations for him and hoped to inspire him to take part in the cross-country race.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: you have work so hard for this event.
detailed_errors.correction: you have worked so hard for this event.
detailed_errors.explanation: 动词时态错误，应使用过去分词‘worked’。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: you've put in so much effort preparing for this race.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: I hope your work hard is rewarding
detailed_errors.correction: I hope all your hard work pays off.
detailed_errors.explanation: ‘work hard’是动词短语，不能作主语；应改为名词性结构。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: I truly believe your dedication will be rewarded.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: with his eyes sparkling with confident
detailed_errors.correction: with his eyes sparkling with confidence
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: his eyes lit up with unwavering confidence.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: David raised his eyes meet my eyes
detailed_errors.correction: David raised his eyes to meet mine.
detailed_errors.explanation: ‘meet’前缺不定式符号‘to’；‘my eyes’可用‘mine’简化。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: David lifted his gaze, locking eyes with me.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: I was pleased beyond description that I can light his strong determination
detailed_errors.correction: I was pleased beyond description that I could ignite his strong determination.
detailed_errors.explanation: 时态错误，应使用过去时‘could’；‘light’不如‘ignite’正式。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: I felt deeply fulfilled knowing I had sparked his inner strength.

detailed_errors.explanation: 原句语法错误，应使用时间状语引导句。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: When the starting gun fired, the race was on.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: So nervous was him that he was slow.
detailed_errors.correction: So nervous was he that he started slowly.
detailed_errors.explanation: 倒装句中主语应为‘he’，而非‘him’；‘slow’应为副词‘slowly’修饰动词。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: Overwhelmed by nerves, he took off at a cautious pace.

revised_text:
We sat down next to each other, but David wouldn’t look at me. He lowered his head, lost in thought. I had high hopes for him, so I wanted to encourage him to join the cross-country team. I comforted him in a soothing voice, 'You’ve worked so hard for this event. I hope all your efforts pay off. I’ll always be here to support you.' My words flowed like a warm stream, touching his soul. David raised his eyes to meet mine, his gaze sparkling with newfound confidence. He felt inspired. I was pleased beyond description that I had ignited his strong determination. After a moment of silence, he smiled and said, 'I hope I can try it.' He laughed, his eyes shining with excitement. I pulled him into my arms and whispered, 'I believe in you—go show them what you’re made of.'

I watched as David moved up to the starting line with the other runners. Yet his heart pounded like a drum, and his palms grew clammy with anticipation. As the starting gun fired, he took off at a cautious pace. So nervous was he that he lagged behind at first. But with every step, his rhythm found its way, and soon he was running—not just for himself, but for everyone who believed in him.
